H0.text: Which US state was admitted to the Union in 1876, hence its nickname of 'the Centennial State'. Nebraska

H1.text: Which US state was admitted to the Union in 1876, hence its nickname of 'the Centennial State'. Nevada

H2.text: Which US state was admitted to the Union in 1876, hence its nickname of 'the Centennial State'. Utah

H3.text: Which US state was admitted to the Union in 1876, hence its nickname of 'the Centennial State'. Colo.

A4.text: U.S. President Ulysses S. Grant signed a proclamation on August 1, 1876, admitting Colorado to the Union as the 38th state.

A5.text: Colorado is nicknamed the 'Centennial State' because it became a state 100 years (and four weeks) after the signing of the United States Declaration of Independence.
